column4: is there any way to use the live CD to fix an install of 8.04?  power supply failed, replaced it, thei it booted into Nautilus w/ no tool bars and a COBRA error
I am using the live cd now
sounds like just the .gnome settings might be in issue
how do I fix it?
Removing the contents of ~/.gnome, ~/.gnome2, ~/.nautilus, ~/.gconf should remove most of the settings and put you back to a default setup
how do I find that using the live CD ?
are you using the live CD to recover a hard drive install?
I am in the live CD now,
the problem is the installed version on the hard drive, been running it for about a year
I am using the live cd to get here
you have to mount the partition that your install is on if it isn't already.
it is not, can  send me the command
do you get this? http://pastebin.com/m1a3fdfe7
media/ disk 1 is the live cd
I found the install, all is locked tho
you were right, disk 1
I can cd to home , then ls is blank
is it because the directory is locked?
can you boot into a recovery console on your bad install?
ty for your time btw, how so I find the recovery console?
k, brb
are you piping the output? Don't pipe the output.
I dont know what you mean
